intro: Opercularia varia var. hispidula, commonly known as the hairy opercularia, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Verrucariaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically covered with a dense layer of fine, hairy structures known as rhizines. The lichen forms a dark, leathery crust on its substrate, often growing on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role in nutrient cycling. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphology and habitat preferences, making it a notable species in lichenology.
